definition: to dismiss students at the end of the school day
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: Many students swarm into the canteen after class.
sentences.chinese: 放學後，很多學生擁進食堂。

sentences.english: Product description: Use as needed! We like to use this blend afterschool, in the morning, and in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 我們喜歡讓孩子放學後，清晨或是在教室裏用一用。

sentences.english: You must hand in your exercise-books after school.
sentences.chinese: 放學後你們必須把練習本交上來。

sentences.english: After school I sat in the office and stared at the records spread out before me.
sentences.chinese: 放學後，我坐在辦公室裏盯着攤放在我面前的檔案。

sentences.english: It is absurd to force children to take extra studies after sch ol.
sentences.chinese: 因此，放學後強迫孩子額外學習是不明智的。

sentences.english: After school, Dongdong and Li Lei go home together.
sentences.chinese: 放學後，東東和李蕾一起回家。

sentences.english: What does Hai Qing usually do after school?
sentences.chinese: 海青放學後通常做什麼？

sentences.english: After school some students are horsing around in the park.
sentences.chinese: 放學後，一些學生在公園裏胡鬧。

sentences.english: After school, do homework before playing.
sentences.chinese: 放學以後，做完作業再玩。

sentences.english: Practices are Tuesdays and Fri- days after school.
sentences.chinese: 練習是星期四和星期五的放學後。

sentences.english: School is over. Li Yan can't be in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 放學了，李豔不可能在教室裏。

sentences.english: After school, we often play football together on the playground.
sentences.chinese: 放學後，我們經常在操場上踢足球。

sentences.english: After school,children wandered in the streets.
sentences.chinese: 放學後，孩子們在街頭閒蕩。

sentences.english: Every time after school, I looked at the basin of Chlorophytum worried.
sentences.chinese: 每次放學，我都擔心地望着那盆吊蘭。

sentences.english: I saw seven or eight of them in the river after school.
sentences.chinese: 我看見七八個孩子放學後在河裏游泳。

sentences.english: After school I am going to run some errands for my mom.
sentences.chinese: 放學後我將爲我母親辦點雜事兒。

definition: to finish class/to get out of class
to go to school/to attend school
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to study outside of class time (reviewing one's lessons)/to study in one's free time/individual study
